perturbation.original_text: 4. Sales Commission Payment. Within sixty (60) days after the end of each calendar quarter during the Term, Imprimis shall deliver to Surgical a report setting forth for such calendar quarter the calculation of the applicable Sales Commission due under this Agreement for the sale of the Product (as defined in the SOW). Imprimis shall remit the total Sales Commission payments due for the sale of Product during such calendar quarter at the time such report is made.
perturbation.changed_text: 4. Sales Commission Payment. Within thirty (30) days after the end of each calendar quarter during the Term, Imprimis shall deliver to Surgical a report setting forth for such calendar quarter the calculation of the applicable Sales Commission due under this Agreement for the sale of the Product (as defined in the SOW). Imprimis shall remit the total Sales Commission payments due for the sale of Product during such calendar quarter at the time such report is made.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a conflict by altering the payment deadline from sixty (60) days to thirty (30) days. This creates ambiguity and uncertainty regarding the correct payment timeframe, potentially leading to disputes between Surgical and Imprimis.

perturbation.original_text:
Term & Termination:

    1. Term. The Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and, unless terminated earlier pursuant to this Agreement or extended by mutual agreement between the parties, shall continue in effect for thirty six (36) months following the Effective Date (the "Term").

    2. Termination. Either party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement at any time for any reason. Expiration or termination of this Agreement shall not limit any obligations of a party that were incurred prior to such expiration or termination.
perturbation.changed_text:
Term & Termination:

    1. Term. The Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and, unless terminated earlier pursuant to this Agreement or extended by mutual agreement between the parties, shall continue in effect for twenty four (24) months following the Effective Date (the "Term").

    2. Termination. Either party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement at any time for any reason. Expiration or termination of this Agreement shall not limit any obligations of a party that were incurred prior to such expiration or termination.
perturbation.explanation: The original term was 36 months. This change alters the defined term of the contract to 24 months while retaining the clause allowing termination at any time. This creates a conflict: is the contract for a fixed 24-month term, or can it be terminated at any point regardless, potentially before the 24 months? This introduces uncertainty in the agreement's duration and enforceability.

perturbation.original_text:
Compensation:

    1. Sales Commissions. During the Term of the Agreement and subject to the terms and conditions of the Agreement, Imprimis shall pay to Surgical Sales Commissions equal to ten percent (10%) of the Net Sales for Product.

          "Net Sales" shall mean the gross sales price of such Product in the Territory invoiced by Imprimis and its affiliates to customers who are not affiliates less: (a) credits, allowances, discounts and rebates to, and chargebacks from the account of, such customers; (b) freight and insurance costs in transporting such Product; (c) cash, quantity and trade discounts, rebates and other price reductions for such Product; (d) sales, use, value-added and other direct taxes; and (e) an allowance  for uncollectible or bad debts determined in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America ("GAAP").
perturbation.changed_text:
Compensation:

    1. Sales Commissions. During the Term of the Agreement and subject to the terms and conditions of the Agreement, Imprimis shall pay to Surgical Sales Commissions equal to fifteen percent (15%) of the Net Sales for Product.

          "Net Sales" shall mean the gross sales price of such Product in the Territory invoiced by Imprimis and its affiliates to customers who are not affiliates less: (a) credits, allowances, discounts and rebates to, and chargebacks from the account of, such customers; (b) freight and insurance costs in transporting such Product; (c) cash, quantity and trade discounts, rebates and other price reductions for such Product; (d) sales, use, value-added and other direct taxes; and (e) an allowance  for uncollectible or bad debts determined in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in generally accepted accounting principles in the country of Imprimis.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a conflict by altering the sales commission percentage from 10% to 15%. Furthermore, it changes the accepted accounting principle from US to the country of Imprimis. This will lead to disputes as the definition of commission percentage and the accounting calculations are conflicting and unclear.
